content.description:
VOTER TURNOUT BY AGE, 2014 CALIFORNIA GENERAL ELECTION
Source: California Secretary of State, 2014
content.question: Which of the following statements about the bar graph on voter turnout in the 2014 California general election is correct?

choices.label: Each age group voted at a higher rate than all of the younger age groups below it.
The majority of voters ages 25–34 voted in the election.
The age group that voted at a rate closest to the average is 45–54.
Voters ages 35–44 voted at a rate higher than average.

content.answer: The age group that voted at a rate closest to the average is 45–54.
